title: Highest Percentage of Female Primary Education Teachers
description: In 2023, an impressive 99.5% of primary education teachers in Belarus were female, showcasing a strong female presence in the education sector.

title: High Educational Attainment for Women
description: By 2023, 98.18% of Belarusian women aged 25 and older had completed at least upper secondary education, reflecting a commitment to female education.

title: Low Maternal Mortality Ratio
description: Belarus recorded a maternal mortality ratio of just 1 per 100,000 live births in 2023, indicating excellent maternal healthcare services.

title: Minimal Carbon Dioxide Emissions from Deforestation
description: In 2022, Belarus reported a net flux of -3.26 Mt CO2e from deforestation, highlighting effective forest management practices.

title: Low Percentage of Private Primary School Enrollment
description: In 2023, only 0.01% of primary school enrollments in Belarus were in private institutions, indicating a strong public education system.

title: High Lifetime Risk of Maternal Death
description: In 2023, the lifetime risk of maternal death in Belarus was 1 in 96,213, suggesting areas for improvement in maternal health.

title: Low Net Bilateral Aid Flows from EU Institutions
description: In 2022, Belarus experienced a negative net bilateral aid flow of -$102.24 million from EU institutions, indicating financial challenges.

title: Low Labor Force with Basic Education Among Males
description: Only 17.82% of the male working-age population in Belarus had basic education in 2023, highlighting a need for educational improvements.
